page.title: 08THE LIFEBOAT STATION
page.content: There has been a lifeboat station since 1828.The present lifeboat is 19 years old.There are 10 voluntary crew men,but only 7 go to sea at one time. The life boat station is on the pier, but a tractor has to pull the lifeboat 300 metres to the slipway.It has to go round the street,taking about 10 mins. The Ilfracombe lifeboat collects 1500 pounds from the public as it is a voluntary organisation.The station is open to the public throughout the year,besides the lifeboat there are lots of interesting photographs and records of rescues.This year the coxwain received a Bronze Medal award for rescuing the yacht Liberty.The Liberty's skipper died of a heart attack,and the other crew member was unable to handle the vessel in difficult conditions.Fortunately,the lifeboat saved the crew member.
